+ set PACKAGE_DIR=spec-share-offline-deploy
+ echo.
+ echo æ­¥éª¤ 2/3: å‡†å¤‡éƒ¨ç½²æ–‡ä»¶...

+ REM å¤åˆ¶æˆ–åˆ›å»º .env æ–‡ä»¶

+     copy /Y .env.example "%PACKAGE_DIR%\.env"

+ )

+ REM åˆ›å»º nginx é…ç½®ç¤ºä¾‹
+ mkdir "%PACKAGE_DIR%\nginx"
+ (
+ echo events {
+ echo     worker_connections 1024;
+ echo }
+ echo.
+ echo http {
+ echo     upstream api {
+ echo         server api:8000;
+ echo     }
+ echo.
+ echo     server {
+ echo         listen 8080;
+ echo         server_name _;
+ echo.
+ echo         location / {
+ echo             proxy_pass http://api;
+ echo             proxy_set_header Host $host;
+ echo             proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;

+ echo         }
+ echo     }

+ echo å¿«é€Ÿå¼€å§‹æŒ‡å—

+ REM ç”Ÿæˆæ—¶é—´æˆ³
+ for /f "tokens=2 delims==" %%I in ('wmic os get localdatetime /value') do set datetime=%%I
+ set TIMESTAMP=%datetime:~0,8%-%datetime:~8,6%

+ echo ======================================
+ echo éƒ¨ç½²åŒ…åˆ›å»ºå®Œæˆï¼

+ echo.

+ if defined SEVENZIP (

+ echo.
+ pause

## æ–¹æ¡ˆä¸‰ï¼šç®€åŒ–çš„çº¯ HTTPS é…ç½®

+ sudo ufw allow 80/tcp   # å¯é€‰ï¼Œç”¨äº HTTP é‡å®šå‘
+ 
+ # CentOS/RHEL (firewalld)
+ sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=https
+ sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=http  # å¯é€‰
+ sudo firewall-cmd --reload
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 3. å¼ºåŒ– JWT å¯†é’¥
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # ç”Ÿæˆå¼ºéšæœºå¯†é’¥

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** â€¢ Edit file: f:\spec-kit\spec-share-server\generate-self-signed-cert.sh</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 76, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,76 @@
- 
+ #!/bin/bash
+ # Generate self-signed SSL certificate for testing
+ # Production environments should use trusted CA certificates
+ 
+ set -e
+ 
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo "Generate Self-Signed SSL Certificate"
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ # Create ssl directory if it doesn't exist
+ mkdir -p ssl
+ 
+ # Check if certificates already exist
+ if [ -f "ssl/privkey.pem" ] &amp;&amp; [ -f "ssl/fullchain.pem" ]; then
+     echo "WARNING: Certificate files already exist in ssl/ directory"
+     read -p "Do you want to overwrite them? (y/N): " -n 1 -r
+     echo
+     if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
+         echo "Aborted."
+         exit 0
+     fi
+ fi
+ 
+ # Get domain name
+ read -p "Enter domain name (default: localhost): " DOMAIN
+ DOMAIN=${DOMAIN:-localhost}
+ 
+ # Get organization name
+ read -p "Enter organization name (default: MyOrg): " ORG
+ ORG=${ORG:-MyOrg}
+ 
+ # Get validity days
+ read -p "Enter certificate validity in days (default: 365): " DAYS
+ DAYS=${DAYS:-365}
+ 
+ echo ""
+ echo "Generating certificate with:"
+ echo "  Domain: $DOMAIN"
+ echo "  Organization: $ORG"
+ echo "  Validity: $DAYS days"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ # Generate self-signed certificate
+ openssl req -x509 -newkey rsa:4096 \
+     -keyout ssl/privkey.pem \
+     -out ssl/fullchain.pem \
+     -days $DAYS \
+     -nodes \
+     -subj "/C=CN/ST=State/L=City/O=$ORG/CN=$DOMAIN"
+ 
+ # Set proper permissions
+ chmod 600 ssl/privkey.pem
+ chmod 644 ssl/fullchain.pem
+ 
+ echo ""
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo "Certificate Generated Successfully!"
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo ""
+ echo "Certificate files:"
+ echo "  Private key: ssl/privkey.pem"
+ echo "  Certificate: ssl/fullchain.pem"
+ echo ""
+ echo "Certificate details:"
+ openssl x509 -in ssl/fullchain.pem -noout -subject -dates
+ echo ""
+ echo "NOTE: This is a self-signed certificate for testing only."
+ echo "Browsers will show security warnings."
+ echo "For production, use certificates from trusted CAs like Let's Encrypt."
+ echo ""
+ echo "You can now start the service with:"
+ echo "  docker compose -f docker-compose.https.yml up -d"
+ echo ""
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

@@ -1,1 +1,97 @@
- 
+ @echo off
+ chcp 65001 &gt;nul 2&gt;&amp;1
+ REM ========================================
+ REM Generate Self-Signed SSL Certificate
+ REM ========================================
+ 
+ setlocal enabledelayedexpansion
+ 
+ echo ======================================
+ echo Generate Self-Signed SSL Certificate
+ echo ======================================
+ echo.
+ 
+ REM Check if OpenSSL is installed
+ where openssl &gt;nul 2&gt;&amp;1
+ if errorlevel 1 (
+     echo ERROR: OpenSSL not found
+     echo.
+     echo Please install OpenSSL:
+     echo   - Download from: https://slproweb.com/products/Win32OpenSSL.html
+     echo   - Or install via Chocolatey: choco install openssl
+     echo   - Or use Git Bash which includes OpenSSL
+     pause
+     exit /b 1
+ )
+ 
+ REM Create ssl directory if it doesn't exist
+ if not exist "ssl" mkdir ssl
+ 
+ REM Check if certificates already exist
+ if exist "ssl\privkey.pem" (
+     if exist "ssl\fullchain.pem" (
+         echo WARNING: Certificate files already exist in ssl\ directory
+         set /p OVERWRITE="Do you want to overwrite them? (y/N): "
+         if /i not "!OVERWRITE!"=="y" (
+             echo Aborted.
+             pause
+             exit /b 0
+         )
+     )
+ )
+ 
+ REM Get domain name
+ set /p DOMAIN="Enter domain name (default: localhost): "
+ if "!DOMAIN!"=="" set DOMAIN=localhost
+ 
+ REM Get organization name
+ set /p ORG="Enter organization name (default: MyOrg): "
+ if "!ORG!"=="" set ORG=MyOrg
+ 
+ REM Get validity days
+ set /p DAYS="Enter certificate validity in days (default: 365): "
+ if "!DAYS!"=="" set DAYS=365
+ 
+ echo.
+ echo Generating certificate with:
+ echo   Domain: !DOMAIN!
+ echo   Organization: !ORG!
+ echo   Validity: !DAYS! days
+ echo.
+ 
+ REM Generate self-signed certificate
+ openssl req -x509 -newkey rsa:4096 ^
+     -keyout ssl\privkey.pem ^
+     -out ssl\fullchain.pem ^
+     -days !DAYS! ^
+     -nodes ^
+     -subj "/C=CN/ST=State/L=City/O=!ORG!/CN=!DOMAIN!"
+ 
+ if errorlevel 1 (
+     echo ERROR: Failed to generate certificate
+     pause
+     exit /b 1
+ )
+ 
+ echo.
+ echo ======================================
+ echo Certificate Generated Successfully!
+ echo ======================================
+ echo.
+ echo Certificate files:
+ echo   Private key: ssl\privkey.pem
+ echo   Certificate: ssl\fullchain.pem
+ echo.
+ echo Certificate details:
+ openssl x509 -in ssl\fullchain.pem -noout -subject -dates
+ echo.
+ echo NOTE: This is a self-signed certificate for testing only.
+ echo Browsers will show security warnings.
+ echo For production, use certificates from trusted CAs like Let's Encrypt.
+ echo.
+ echo You can now start the service with:
+ echo   docker compose -f docker-compose.https.yml up -d
+ echo.
+ 
+ pause
+ 
```

+ # ==================== ç”Ÿäº§é˜¶æ®µ ====================
+ FROM nginx:alpine
+ 
+ # å¤åˆ¶æ„å»ºäº§ç‰©åˆ° nginx
+ COPY --from=builder /app/dist /usr/share/nginx/html
+ 
+ # å¤åˆ¶ nginx é…ç½®
+ COPY nginx.conf /etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf
+ 
+ # æš´éœ²ç«¯å£
+ EXPOSE 80
+ 
+ # å¯åŠ¨ nginx
+ CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]
+ 
```

**Chunk 1**

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,104 @@
- 
+ #!/bin/bash
+ # å®Œæ•´å‰åç«¯ç¦»çº¿å®‰è£…è„šæœ¬
+ 
+ set -e
+ 
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo "Full Stack Offline Installation"
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ # Check Docker
+ if ! command -v docker &amp;&gt; /dev/null; then
+     echo "ERROR: Docker not found, please install Docker first"
+     exit 1
+ fi
+ 
+ # Check Docker Compose
+ if docker compose version &amp;&gt; /dev/null 2&gt;&amp;1; then
+     DOCKER_COMPOSE="docker compose"
+ elif command -v docker-compose &amp;&gt; /dev/null; then
+     DOCKER_COMPOSE="docker-compose"
+ else
+     echo "ERROR: Docker Compose not found"
+     exit 1
+ fi
+ 
+ # Check export directory
+ EXPORT_DIR="docker-images-export"
+ if [ ! -d "$EXPORT_DIR" ]; then
+     echo "ERROR: Image export directory $EXPORT_DIR not found"
+     echo "Please ensure exported image files are in this directory"
+     exit 1
+ fi
+ 
+ echo "Step 1/5: Checking image files..."
+ if [ ! -f "$EXPORT_DIR/spec-share-server.tar" ]; then
+     echo "ERROR: spec-share-server.tar not found"
+     exit 1
+ fi
+ 
+ if [ ! -f "$EXPORT_DIR/spec-share-frontend.tar" ]; then
+     echo "ERROR: spec-share-frontend.tar not found"
+     exit 1
+ fi
+ 
+ if [ ! -f "$EXPORT_DIR/nginx-alpine.tar" ]; then
+     echo "ERROR: nginx-alpine.tar not found"
+     exit 1
+ fi
+ 
+ echo "[OK] Image files check complete"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ echo "Step 2/5: Importing Docker images..."
+ echo "Importing backend image..."
+ docker load -i "$EXPORT_DIR/spec-share-server.tar"
+ 
+ echo "Importing frontend image..."
+ docker load -i "$EXPORT_DIR/spec-share-frontend.tar"
+ 
+ echo "Importing nginx image..."
+ docker load -i "$EXPORT_DIR/nginx-alpine.tar"
+ 
+ echo "[OK] Images imported successfully"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ echo "Step 3/5: Verifying images..."
+ docker images | grep -E "spec-share-(server|frontend)|nginx"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ echo "Step 4/5: Creating necessary directories..."
+ mkdir -p data
+ mkdir -p nginx
+ mkdir -p ssl
+ 
+ echo "[OK] Directories created"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ echo "Step 5/5: Preparing frontend static files (if using fullstack-https)..."
+ echo "Note: For fullstack-https deployment, you need to extract frontend files"
+ echo "Run: docker create --name temp spec-share-frontend:latest"
+ echo "     docker cp temp:/usr/share/nginx/html ./frontend-dist"
+ echo "     docker rm temp"
+ echo ""
+ 
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo "Installation Complete!"
+ echo "======================================"
+ echo ""
+ echo "You can now start services with:"
+ echo ""
+ echo "  # HTTP deployment (frontend + backend)"
+ echo "  $DOCKER_COMPOSE -f docker-compose.fullstack.yml up -d"
+ echo ""
+ echo "  # HTTPS deployment (requires SSL certificates)"
+ echo "  $DOCKER_COMPOSE -f docker-compose.fullstack-https.yml up -d"
+ echo ""
+ echo "View logs:"
+ echo "  $DOCKER_COMPOSE -f docker-compose.fullstack.yml logs -f"
+ echo ""
+ echo "Stop services:"
+ echo "  $DOCKER_COMPOSE -f docker-compose.fullstack.yml down"
+ echo ""
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>
